title-part.text: RIDER-OPERATED TERMINAL CONTROLS SPECIALLY ADAPTED FOR CYCLES
CYCLE SIDE-CARS, FORECARS, OR THE LIKE

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass, each of the main groups B62K7/00 to B62K15/00 takes precedence over all the preceding main groups, e.g. a child`s bicycle is classified in B62K9/00 and not in B62K3/00

CPC-specific-text.text: without a seat, i.e. the rider operating the vehicle in a standing position, e.g. non-motorized scooters; non-motorized scooters with skis or runners
Automatic balancing machines supporting a rider, e.g. "Segways"

title-part.text: having a substantially horizontal top bar
of single-beam type, i.e. connecting steering head to rear axle
Cycles with handlebars, equipped with three or more main road wheels

reference.text: cycle supports or stands equipped with additional wheels for ride stabilisation B62H1/12

note.note-paragraph: Groups B62K5/003 - B62K5/10 correspond to IPC2013.01

title-part.text: Cycles with four or more wheels, specially adapted for disabled riders, e.g. personal mobility type vehicles with four wheels
Motorcycles with four or more wheels

reference.text: specially adapted for disabled riders B62K5/003

title-part.text: specially adapted for disabled riders, e.g. personal mobility type vehicles with three wheels

reference.text: specially adapted for disabled riders B62K5/023

title-part.text: characterised by a single rear wheel
with steering devices acting on two or more wheels
with means for inwardly inclining the vehicle body on bends
Motorcycles, engine-assisted cycles or motor scooters with one or two wheels

reference.text: fairings or streamlining parts not forming part of the frame B62J; transmission of drive from engines to wheels B62M
motor-cycles or cycles with auxiliary engines characterised by position of engine B62M

title-part.text: characterised by the engine being between front and rear wheels
the frame being of single-beam type
the beam being fabricated from sheet metal, e.g. forming fuel tank walls
characterised by the engine being over or beside driven rear wheel
Steering wheel forks characterised by the association therewith of engine
Handle-bar constructions, or arrangements of controls thereon, specially adapted thereto
Cycles convertible to, or transformable into, other type of cycle or land vehicle

reference.text: cycle supports or stands equipped with additional wheels for ride stabilisation B62H1/12

title-part.text: to a quadricycle, e.g. by coupling together two bicycles side by side

reference.text: cycle frames specially adapted for one particular kin of cycle specified in groups B62K1/00 to B62K17/00, see the relevant group

title-part.text: characterised by material or cross-section of frame members
the material being wholly or mainly metallic, e.g. of high elasticity
the material being wholly or mainly wood
the material being wholly or mainly of plastics
Frame parts shaped to receive other cycle parts or accessories
for attaching saddle pillars, e.g. adjustable during ride
for attaching accessories, e.g. article carriers, lamps

reference.text: attachment devices not forming part of frame B62J11/02

title-part.text: Luggage carriers forming part of frame

reference.text: steering devices specially adapted for one particular kind of cycle specified in groups B62K1/00 to B62K17/00, see the relevant group

CPC-specific-text.text: Steering pivot axis arranged within the wheel e.g. for a hub center steering arrangement

title-part.text: Front wheel forks or equivalent, e.g. single tine
Bearings specially adapted for steering heads
Mechanisms for restoring steering device to straigt-ahead position
Connections between forks and handle-bars or handle-bar stems
Rider-operated controls specially adapted for cycles, i.e. means for initiating control operations, e.g. levers, grips

reference.text: specially adapted to cycle brake mechanisms B62L3/00
arrangements of controls on handle-bars of engine-driven cycles B62K11/14

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by the axle being supported at one end only

title-part.text: for mounting axles rigidly on cycle frame or fork, e.g. adjustably
for mounting axles resiliently on cycle frame or fork

reference.text: for sidecars, forecars or the like B62K27/06

title-part.text: with telescopic fork, e.g. including auxiliary rocking arms
with rocking arm pivoted on each fork leg

reference.text: in combination with telescopic fork B62K25/06

title-part.text: with single arm on each fork leg
the arm being pivoted intermediate its ends
with more than one arm on each fork leg

CPC-specific-text.text: for cycles without a pedal crank, e.g. motorcycles
the shock absorber being connected to the chain-stay via a linkage mechanism
Trailers or the like specially adapted to be attached to cycles

reference.text: trailers B60P; B62D; characterised by carrying propulsion engine

note.note-paragraph: This group and its subgroups are not complete pending a reclassification; see also B62K27/00 and subgroups

title-part.text: Coupling parts for attaching cars or the like to cycle
Cycles with handlebars, equipped with three or more main road wheels

reference.text: cycle supports or stands equipped with additional wheels for ride stabilisation B62H1/12

note.note-paragraph: Groups B62K5/003 - B62K5/10 correspond to IPC2013.01

title-part.text: Suspension details for cycles with three or more main road wheels
with adaptations to be used as golf carts
Frames adapted to be easily dismantled
having a foldable crank or pedal
having additional wheels for use when folded or collapsed
for mounting axles rigidly on cycle frame or fork, e.g. adjustably
for mounting axles resiliently on cycle frame or fork

reference.text: for sidecars, forecars or the like B62K27/06

title-part.text: the cycle frame being made of a flexible material
Springs used in cycle frames or parts thereof
Adaptations for driving cycles by electric motor

reference.text: for driving electrically assisted bicycles B62M6/00

title-part.text: Quick release mechanisms adapted for cycles
Sensors adapted for use on cycles, not otherwise provided for
for sensing lateral inclination of the cycle
for sensing longitudinal inclination of the cycle
Arrangements of batteries on cycles, when not used for a cycle with auxiliary electric motor as provided for in B62M6/90

note.note-paragraph:
1) This code and all of its subdivisions are not used for classification of new documents;
2) This code and all its subdivisions were used for indexing documents which were classified in the former Dutch IdT main group 63B and sub-groups, and which have been administratively classified in best proximate CPC groups

title-part.text: Frames for cycles characterised by the material used, i.e. where the construction of the frame is unimportant
Frames for cycles characterised by the shape of the material used
Frames for cycles characterised by the kind of material used
Frames constructed from another material other than wood or metal
Frames for cycles characterised by their shape
Frames for cycles with two wheels positioned next to one another
Frames for cycles with two wheels positioned one behind the other
Polygonal frames with four sides, for men
Frames with crossing elements connecting between the steering head tube and the seat tube
Frames for cycles with two wheels positioned one behind the other, e.g. cycles with a special usage
Frames characterised by the position of the cyclist
Frames for a plurality of cyclists
Frames for cycles propelled by foot contact on the ground, scooters
Frames of a special shape with regard to luggage transportation
Frames or general construction of cycles with side cars or trailers

note.note-paragraph: 1) This code and all its subdivisions are not used for classification of new documents; 2) This code and all its subdivisions were used for indexing documents which were classified in the former Dutch IdT main group 63H and sub-groups, and which have been administratively classified in best proximate CPC groups

title-part.text: Side cars and trailers for cycles
Bodywork, mudguards, luggage carriers, heating or ventilation devices
Steering mechanisms for motorcycles with side cars or for side cars with a driven wheel
Trailers for cycles and their couplings
